name: NETXP EQL Arbitrary Code Guard preventing editing code page status
description: ACG (Arbitrary Code Guard) is a security feature in Microsoft Edge designed to enhance security. It prevents and logs attempts to modify permissions of code pages, specifically making pages writeable. Additionally, ACG disallows the creation of unsigned code pages. Code pages without proper digital signatures are considered unsigned, and ACG ensures that only signed code pages are allowed. By actively monitoring and controlling code page permissions, ACG mitigates the risk of arbitrary native code execution.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
any where event.code == "1" or event.code == "2" and winlog.channel: "Microsoft-Windows-Security-Mitigations"  
// oczekuje dodanego kanalu Mitigations
